alert.note: Alert for Carson; Collingsworth; Donley; Gray; Hutchinson; Roberts; Wheeler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 4:28AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Wheeler, eastern Carson, southeastern Hutchinson, Gray, southwestern Roberts, Collingsworth and northern Donley Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 425 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles north of Panhandle to 9 miles northwest of Lake Mcclellan to 6 miles south of Mclean to 4 miles southwest of Quail. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pampa, Panhandle, Wellington, Shamrock, White Deer, Mclean, Groom, Lefors, Skellytown, Lutie, Lake Mcclellan, Lela, Samnorwood, Quail, Kellerville, Kingsmill, Dozier and Alanreed. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Carson; Collingsworth; Donley; Gray; Hutchinson; Roberts; Wheeler
